news.title: Berkshire Hathaway operating earnings dip 4% as conglomerate braces for tariff impact
news.summary: Berkshire's operating profit dipped 4% year over year to $11.16 billion in the second quarter. The company's net income was $2.2 billion, down from $3.1 billion a year earlier.

news.title: Trump fires commissioner of labor statistics after weaker-than-expected jobs figures slam markets
news.summary: Trump accused BLS Commissioner Erika McEntarfer of being a political appointee who was manipulating jobs data. Trump accused McEntrfer of manipulating jobsData.

news.title: Fed Governor Kugler is resigning, giving Trump a nominee on committee that sets interest rates
news.summary: The resignation now paves the way for Trump to put his own nominee in for the Board of Governors. Trump's own nominee for the board is expected to be announced later this week.

news.title: Here's where the jobs are in this slowing economy
news.summary: July's much weaker-than-expected job growth was supported primarily by the health-care sector, data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics released Friday shows.

news.title: JFK airport's $9.5 billion international terminal is taking shape. See what's inside
news.summary: JFK's new fully-international-travel dedicated terminal opens in mid-2026. The terminal will be the world's first of its kind.

news.title: Afraid to leave your job right now? Here’s how to stay put without killing your career.
news.summary: Friday’s jobs report is good news for those who have been feeling guilty about not looking for a new job. The jobs report shows that the U.S. economy is improving.

news.title: Don’t blame Jerome Powell — or the Fed — if you can’t afford to buy a house right now
news.summary: Trump says high interest rates are keeping Americans from buying houses. There’s more to it than that. Trump: “I’m going to make it very easy for people to buy houses.”

news.title: Private-credit ETFs are here. Why your retirement account may be their next target.
news.summary: Private-credit ETFs aren’t in 401(k)s yet, but they are Wall Street’s latest effort to bring private assets to the masses.

news.title: Here’s what the E.U. and South Korea trade deals mean for U.S. natural-gas investors
news.summary: The European Union and South Korea have pledged to buy billions of dollars’ worth of energy products under trade deals with the Trump administration. The White House aims to capitalize on the U.S. as the world’s largest exporter of liquefied natural gas.

news.title: ‘I have never been asked for money before’: My friend wants to borrow $1,600 to pay her rent. Do I say yes?
news.summary: “I have heard mixed reviews on lending people money,” he says. “I’m not sure what the future holds for me.”
